metadata.title: CVE-2019-1789 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
ClamAV versions prior to 0.101.2 are susceptible to a denial of service(DoS) vulnerability. An out-of-bounds heap read condition may occur whenscanning PE files. An example is Windows EXE and DLL files that have beenpacked using Aspack as a result of inadequate bound-checking.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-1789` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-base - 0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libclamav7 - 0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
